result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:19 AM Defendant Gerivonnie Marquis Lewis appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant has not received a copy of the Criminal Complaint. A copy will be mailed to him at the new address given on the record. 
Bail is set at $300 recognizance bond with the conditions that he is to have no contact with the Fireside Pub. Bail bond mailed to the defendant to be signed and returned. 
Court also orders the defendant to report to TRPD for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
